column4: help i cant install the xorg-driver-fglrx package. can anyone help me plz
Why not?
keeps saying break (install)
Hmmm.. All the repositories enabled and everything?
i'm currently in adept manager, how can i check if all repositiories are enabled?
I'm in vista so Im not too much use at the moment, what I would do is a google search to see what repo's are needed, then go into the sources manager and see if the correct ones are enabled
i have multiverse, universe and restricted checked
Did you google to see if any extra reos are needed?
Youhave an xorg.conf file
sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf
Find it?
i need to be able to access it using the command - >  sudo aticonfig --initial --input=/etc/X11/xorg.conf   but when i do this it says no conf file
Did you check to make sure its there? Also it could by a syntax error
thats the thing in /etc/X11/ there is no xorg.conf file. only xorg.conf.original-0 and xorg.conf.1 and xorg.conf.2
sudo cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf.1 /etc/X11/xorg.conf
Or which ever xorg file was working for you
ok copied it, but now when i run aticonfig -- initial i get -> aticonfig: writting to '/etc/X11/xorg.conf' failed. ad file descriptor
Dunno .. buy an nvidia card??
After a while the opportunity cost of trying to get the ATI card to work is just not worth it when the nvidia card wil most likely be up and running before you can say 'ati shinanigans'
yeh. thanks for help tho :)
Sorry, I never tried to get an ati card to work.. namely because I hated them since around 1997 when 3 of my friends had fault al-in-wonders ... AFAIK, ati drivers to run compiz are faily new
